title: iPhone PD Engineering Program Specialist
summary:
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish. Dynamic, resourceful people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with all Apple Hardware products. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices strengthening our dedication to leave the world better than we found it. Do you want to join us in these pursuits? Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple products!

iPhone Engineering Program Management is a collaborative team looking for a resourceful, energetic Engineering Project Specialist (EPS) to handle program logistics, materials, finances, and security. Have an understanding of complex Bills of Materials and documentation experience. Enclosure EPS must be able to prioritize issues and track the details, be a strong organizer, be a self-motived driver, ready to work with the Engineering Project Management and engineering cross-functional teams to take care of the risks associated with each engineering program build.
description:
-  Work closely with product designers (PD), and engineering project manager (EPM) to create, structure and release Bill of Materials (BOM) for development builds, including part numbers, engineering change orders, and related technical drawings, and documents

-  Manage material drive with upstream and downstream vendors to ensure materials arrive on time; including daily communication on changes

-  Manage Purchase-to-Pay activities including the creation of purchase requisitions, maintain invoice tracking, create/maintain purchase order log/tracker, and provide approval for general receipts for small parts

-  Partner with PD EPM to manage small parts budget and maintain budget accuracy

-  Work on multiple projects simultaneously and manage competing priorities

-  May require international travel!
preferred_qualifications:
Knowledge of configuration management and experience in BOM structuring (preferably for hardware products)
Experience with PLM tools
Ability to influence, effectively communicate and drive deadlines with vendors (either CM or part vendors)
Able to quickly learn new software, and stay up-to-date with internal tools
Ability to react to re-set and changes in a very dynamic and time-sensitive environment
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with excellent interpersonal and multitasking skills
Combination of organizational, time/task management, and detail-oriented skills when working on multiple projects
Strong and effective communication (written and verbal); able to work in a dynamic, large cross-functional team environment and embraces ambiguous situations and drives closure
